Distribution Class

new_dist.Rd

Create a distribution class:

OOP.

Usage

new_dist(
  name = NULL,
  type = c("continous", "discrete"),
  ddist = NULL,
  supp = NA,
  cdist = NULL,
  qdist = NULL,
  hdist = NULL,
  ...,
  class = character()
)

Arguments

name

A name.

type

"continous" or "discrete".

ddist

density function.

cdist

cdf.

hdist

hazard function.

support

support.

Value

A dist class.

Examples

normal_density <- function(x, par1 = 0, par2 = 1) { dnorm(x, mean = par1, sd = par2) }
normal_cdf <- function(x, par1 = 0, par2 = 1) { pnorm(x, mean = par1, sd = par2) }
normal_hazard <- function(x, par1 = 0, par2 = 1) { normal_density(x, par1, par2) / ( 1 - normal_cdf(x, par1, par2) ) }
x <- new_dist(name = "my.normal",  type = "continous", ddist = normal_density, supp = c(-Inf,Inf), cdist = normal_cdf, hdist = normal_hazard)
print(x)
#> [1] "my.normal is a continous distribution defined from -Inf to Inf."

y <- new_dist(ddist=dexp, type="continous", name="exponential", supp=c(0,Inf))
plot(y,type="b",pch=16)
#> Error in x$qdist(0.001): attempt to apply non-function

z <- new_dist()
plot(y+z,type="l",col=2)
#> Error in uniroot((function(x) f(x) - y), lower = lower, upper = upper): f() values at end points not of opposite sign
save(x,y,z, file="data/dist.rda")
#> Warning: cannot open compressed file 'data/dist.rda', probable reason 'No such file or directory'
#> Error in gzfile(file, "wb"): cannot open the connection
